text: Office of the Secretary, Interior

text: U.S. Department of the Interior, Wash-
label: BODY

text: ington, DC 20240.
label: BODY

text: (b) Form of requests. (1) Requests
label: BODY

text: under this subpart shall be in writing
label: BODY

text: and must specifically invoke the Act.
label: BODY

text: (2) A request must reasonably de-
label: BODY

text: scribe the records requested. A request
label: BODY

text: reasonably describes the records re-
label: BODY

text: quested if it will enable an employee of
label: BODY

text: the Department familiar with the sub-
label: BODY

text: ject area of the request to locate the
label: BODY

text: record with a reasonable amount of ef-
label: BODY

text: fort. If such information is available,
label: BODY

text: the request should identify the subject
label: BODY

text: matter of the record, the date when it
label: BODY

text: was made, the place where it was made,
label: BODY

text: the person or office that made it, the
label: BODY

text: present custodian of the record, and
label: BODY

text: any other information that will assist
label: BODY

text: in locating the requested record. If the
label: BODY

text: request involves a matter known by
label: BODY

text: the requester to be in litigation, the re-
label: BODY

text: quest should also state the case name
label: BODY

text: and court hearing the case.
label: BODY

text: (3)(i) A request shall—
label: BODY

text: Specify
label: BODY

text: the
label: BODY

text: fee
label: BODY

text: category
label: BODY

text: (commercial use, news media, edu-
label: BODY

text: cational
label: BODY

text: institution,
label: BODY

text: noncommercial
label: BODY

text: scientific institution, or other) in
label: BODY

text: which the requester claims the request
label: BODY

text: to fall and the basis of this claim (see
label: BODY

text: § 2.20(b) through (e) for definitions) and
label: BODY

text: (B) State the maximum amount of
label: BODY

text: fees that the requester is willing to pay
label: BODY

text: or include a request for a fee waiver.
label: BODY

text: (ii) Requesters are advised that,
label: BODY

text: under § 2.20 (f) and (g), the time for re-
label: BODY

text: sponding to requests may be delayed—
label: BODY

text: (A) If a requester has not sufficiently
label: BODY

text: identified the fee category applicable
label: BODY

text: to the request,
label: BODY

text: (B) If a requester has not stated a
label: BODY

text: willingness to pay fees as high as an-
label: BODY

text: ticipated by the Department or
label: BODY

text: (C) If a fee waiver request is denied
label: BODY

text: and the requester has not included an
label: BODY

text: alternative statement of willingness to
label: BODY

text: pay fees as high as anticipated by the
label: BODY

text: Department.
label: BODY

text: (4) A request seeking a fee waiver
label: BODY

text: shall, to the extent possible, address
label: BODY

text: why the requester believes that the cri-
label: BODY

text: teria for fee waivers set out in § 2.21 are
label: BODY

text: met.
label: BODY

text: (5) To ensure expeditious handling,
label: BODY

text: requests
label: BODY

text: should
label: BODY

text: prominently
label: BODY

text: marked, both the envelope and on the
label: BODY

text: face of the request, with the legend
label: BODY

text: ‘‘FREEDOM OF INFORMATION RE-
label: BODY

text: QUEST.’’
label: BODY

text: (c) Creation of records. A request may
label: BODY

text: seek only records that are in existence
label: BODY

text: at the time the request is received. A
label: BODY

text: request may not seek records that
label: BODY

text: come into existence after the date on
label: BODY

text: which it is received and may not re-
label: BODY

text: quire that new records be created in re-
label: BODY

text: sponse to the request by, for example,
label: BODY

text: combining or compiling selected items
label: BODY

text: from manual files, preparing a new
label: BODY

text: computer program, or calculating pro-
label: BODY

text: portions, percentages, frequency dis-
label: BODY

text: tributions, trends or comparisons. In
label: BODY

text: those instances where the Department
label: BODY

text: determines that creating a new record
label: BODY

text: will be less burdensome than disclosing
label: BODY

text: large volumes of unassembled mate-
label: BODY

text: rial, the Department may, in its discre-
label: BODY

text: tion, agree to creation of a new record
label: BODY

text: as an alternative to disclosing existing
label: BODY

text: records.
label: BODY

text: [52 FR 45586, Nov. 30, 1987, as amended at 67
label: BODY

text: Preliminary processing of re-
label: BODY

text: quests.
label: BODY

text: (a) Scope of requests. (1) Unless a re-
label: BODY

text: quest clearly specifies otherwise, re-
label: BODY

text: quests to field installations of a bureau
label: BODY

text: may be presumed to seek only records
label: BODY

text: at that installation and requests to a
label: BODY

text: bureau head or bureau FOIA officer
label: BODY

text: may be presumed to seek only records
label: BODY

text: of that bureau.
label: BODY

text: (2) If a request to a field installation
label: BODY

text: of a bureau specifies that it seeks
label: BODY

text: records located at other installations
label: BODY

text: of the same bureau, the installation
label: BODY

text: shall refer the request to the other in-
label: BODY

text: stallation(s) or the bureau FOIA officer
label: BODY

text: for appropriate processing. The time
label: BODY

text: limit provided in § 2.17(a) does not start
label: BODY

text: until the request is received at the in-
label: BODY

text: stallation having the records or by the
label: BODY

text: bureau FOIA officer.
label: BODY

text: (3) If a request to a bureau specifies
label: BODY

text: that it seeks records of another bureau,
label: BODY

text: the bureau may return the request (or
label: BODY

text: the relevant portion thereof) to the re-
label: BODY

text: quester with instructions as to how the
label: BODY

text: request may be resubmitted to the
label: BODY

text: other bureau.
label: BODY

text: (b) Intradepartmental consultation and
label: BODY

text: referral. (1) If a bureau (other than the
label: BODY

text: Office of Inspector General) receives a
label: BODY

text: request for records in its possession
label: BODY

text: VerDate 0ct<31>2002
label: BODY

text: Y:\SGML\197172T.XXX
label: BODY

text: 43 CFR Subtitle A (10–1–02 Edition)
label: BODY

text: that originated with or are of substan-
label: BODY

text: tial concern to another bureau, it shall
label: BODY

text: consult with that bureau before decid-
label: BODY

text: ing whether to release or withhold the
label: BODY

text: records.
label: BODY

text: (2) As an alternative to consultation,
label: BODY

text: a bureau may refer the request (or the
label: BODY

text: relevant protion thereof) to the bureau
label: BODY

text: that originated or is substantially con-
label: BODY

text: cerned with the records. Such referrals
label: BODY

text: shall be made expeditiously and the re-
label: BODY

text: quester shall be notified in writing
label: BODY

text: that a referral has been made. A refer-
label: BODY

text: ral under this paragraph does not re-
label: BODY

text: start the time limit provided in § 2.17.
label: BODY

text: (c) Records of other departments and
label: BODY

text: agencies. (1) If a requested record in the
label: BODY

text: possession of the Department of the In-
label: BODY

text: terior originated with another Federal
label: BODY

text: department or agency, the request
label: BODY

text: shall be referred to that agency un-
label: BODY

text: less—
label: BODY

text: (i) The record is of primary interest
label: BODY

text: to the Department,
label: BODY

text: (ii) The Department is in a better po-
label: BODY

text: sition than the originating agency to
label: BODY

text: assess whether the record is exempt
label: BODY

text: from disclosure, or
label: BODY

text: (iii) The originating agency is not
label: BODY

text: subject to the Act.
label: BODY

text: The Department has primary interest
label: BODY

text: in a record if it was developed or pre-
label: BODY

text: pared pursuant to Department regula-
label: BODY

text: tions, directives or request.
label: BODY

text: (2) In accordance with Execuctive
label: BODY

text: Order 12356, a request for documents
label: BODY

text: that were classified by another agency
label: BODY

text: shall be referred to that agency.
label: BODY

text: (d) Consultation with submitters of com-
label: BODY

text: mercial and financial information. (1) If a
label: BODY

text: request seeks a record containing trade
label: BODY

text: secrets or commercial or financial in-
label: BODY

text: formation submitted by a person out-
label: BODY

text: side of the Federal government, the bu-
label: BODY

text: reau processing the request shall pro-
label: BODY

text: vide the submitter with notice of the
label: BODY

text: request whenever—
label: BODY

text: (i) The submitter has made a good
label: BODY

text: faith designation of the information as
label: BODY

text: commercially or financially sensitive,
label: BODY

text: (ii) The bureau has reason to believe
label: BODY

text: that disclosure of the information may
label: BODY

text: result in commercial or financial in-
label: BODY

text: jury to the submitter.
label: BODY

text: Where notification of a voluminous
label: BODY

text: number of submitters is required, such
label: BODY

text: notification may be accomplished by
label: BODY

text: posting or publishing the notice in a
label: BODY

text: place reasonably calculated to accom-
label: BODY

text: plish notification.
label: BODY

text: (2) The notice to the submitter shall
label: BODY

text: afford the submitter a reasonable pe-
label: BODY

text: riod within which to provide a detailed
label: BODY

text: statement of any objection to disclo-
label: BODY

text: sure. The submitter’s statement shall
label: BODY

text: explain the basis on which the informa-
label: BODY

text: tion is claimed to be exempt under the
label: BODY

text: FOIA, including a specification of any
label: BODY

text: claim of competitive or other business
label: BODY

text: harm that would result from disclo-
label: BODY

text: sure. The statement shall also include
label: BODY

text: a certification that the information is
label: BODY

text: confidential, has not been disclosed to
label: BODY

text: the public by the submitter, and is not
label: BODY

text: routinely available to the public from
label: BODY

text: other sources.
label: BODY

text: (3) If a submitter’s statement cannot
label: BODY

text: be obtained within the time limit for
label: BODY

text: processing the request under § 2.17, the
label: BODY

text: requester shall be notified of the delay
label: BODY

text: as provided in § 2.17(f).
label: BODY

text: (4) Notification to a submitter is not
label: BODY

text: required if:
label: BODY

text: (i) The bureau determines, prior to
label: BODY

text: giving notice, that the request for the
label: BODY

text: record should be denied;
label: BODY

text: (ii) The information has previously
label: BODY

text: been lawfully published or officially
label: BODY

text: made available to the public;
label: BODY

text: (iii) Disclosure is required by a stat-
label: BODY

text: ute (other than the FOIA) or regula-
label: BODY

text: tion (other than this subpart);
label: BODY

text: (iv) Disclosure is clearly prohibited
label: BODY

text: by a statute, as described in § 2.13(c)(3);
label: BODY

text: (v) The information was not des-
label: BODY

text: ignated by the submitter as confiden-
label: BODY

text: tial when it was submitted, or a rea-
label: BODY

text: sonable time thereafter, if the sub-
label: BODY

text: mitter was specifically afforded an op-
label: BODY

text: portunity to make such a designation;
label: BODY

text: however, a submitter will be notified of
label: BODY

text: a request for information that was not
label: BODY

text: designated as confidential at the time
label: BODY

text: of submission, or a reasonable time
label: BODY

text: thereafter, if there is substantial rea-
label: BODY

text: son to believe that disclosure of the in-
label: BODY

text: formation would result in competitive
label: BODY

text: harm.
label: BODY

text: (vi) The designation of confiden-
label: BODY

text: tiality made by the submitter is obvi-
label: BODY

text: ously frivolous; or
label: BODY

text: (vii) The information was submitted
label: BODY

text: to the Department more than 10 years
label: BODY

text: prior to the date of the request, unless
label: BODY

text: the bureau has reason to believe that it
label: BODY

text: continues to be confidential.
label: BODY

text: Office of the Secretary, Interior
label: BODY

text: (5) If a requester brings suit to com-
label: BODY

text: pel disclosure of information, the sub-
label: BODY

text: mitter of the information will be
label: BODY

text: promptly notified.
label: BODY

text: Action on initial requests.
label: BODY

text: (a) Authority. (1) Requests to field in-
label: BODY

text: stallations shall be decided by the head
label: BODY

text: of the installation or by such higher
label: BODY

text: authority as the head of the bureau
label: BODY

text: may designate in writing.
label: BODY

text: (2) Requests to the headquarters of a
label: BODY

text: bureau shall be decided only by the
label: BODY

text: head of the bureau or an official whom
label: BODY

text: the head of the bureau has in writing
label: BODY

text: designated.
label: BODY

text: (3) Requests to the Office of the Sec-
label: BODY

text: retary may be decided by the Director
label: BODY

text: of Administrative Services, an Assist-
label: BODY

text: ant Secretary or Assistant Secretary’s
label: BODY

text: designee, and any official whom the
label: BODY

text: Secretary has in writing designated.
label: BODY

text: (4) A decision to withhold a requested
label: BODY

text: record, to release a record that is ex-
label: BODY

text: empt from disclosure, or to deny a fee
label: BODY

text: waiver shall be made only after con-
label: BODY

text: sultation with the office of the appro-
label: BODY

text: priate associate, regional, or field so-
label: BODY

text: licitor.
label: BODY

text: (b) Form of grant. (1) When a re-
label: BODY

text: quested record has been determined to
label: BODY

text: be available, the official processing the
label: BODY

text: request shall notify the requester as to
label: BODY

text: when and where the record is available
label: BODY

text: for inspection or, as the case may be,
label: BODY

text: when and how copies will be provided.
label: BODY

text: If fees are due, the official shall state
label: BODY

text: the amount of fees due and the proce-
label: BODY

text: dures for payment, as described in
label: BODY

text: (2) If a requested record (or portion
label: BODY

text: thereof) is being made available over
label: BODY

text: the objections of a submitter made in
label: BODY

text: accordance with § 2.15(d), both the re-
label: BODY

text: quester and the submitter shall be no-
label: BODY

text: tified of the decision. The notice to the
label: BODY

text: submitter (a copy of which shall be
label: BODY

text: made available to the requester) shall
label: BODY

text: be forwarded a reasonable number of
label: BODY

text: days prior to the date on which disclo-
label: BODY

text: sure is to be made and shall include:
label: BODY

text: (i) A statement of the reasons why
label: BODY

text: the submitter’s objections were not
label: BODY

text: sustained;
label: BODY

text: (ii) A specification of the portions of
label: BODY

text: the record to be disclosed, if the sub-
label: BODY

text: mitter’s objections were sustained in
label: BODY

text: part; and
label: BODY

text: (iii) A specified disclosure date.
label: BODY

text: (3) If a claim of confidentiality has
label: BODY

text: been found frivolous in accordance
label: BODY

text: with § 2.15(d)(4)(vi) and a determination
label: BODY

text: is made to release the information
label: BODY

text: without consultation with the sub-
label: BODY

text: mitter, the submitter of the informa-
label: BODY

text: tion shall be notified of the decision
label: BODY

text: and the reasons therefor a reasonable
label: BODY

text: number of days prior to the date on
label: BODY

text: which disclosure is to be made.
label: BODY

text: (c) Form of denial. (1) A decision with-
label: BODY

text: holding a requested record shall be in
label: BODY

text: writing and shall include:
label: BODY

text: (i) A reference to the specific exemp-
label: BODY

text: tion or exemptions authorizing the
label: BODY

text: withholding;
label: BODY

text: (ii) If neither a statute or an Execu-
label: BODY

text: tive order requires withholding, the
label: BODY

text: sound ground for withholding;
label: BODY

text: (iii) A listing of the names and titles
label: BODY

text: or positions of each person responsible
label: BODY

text: for the denial; and
label: BODY

text: (iv) A statement that the denial may
label: BODY

text: be appealed to the Assistant Sec-
label: BODY

text: retary—Policy, Budget and Adminis-
label: BODY

text: tration and a description of the proce-
label: BODY

text: dures in § 2.18 for appeal.
label: BODY

text: (2) A decision denying a request for
label: BODY

text: failure
label: BODY

text: reasonably
label: BODY

text: describe
label: BODY

text: re-
label: BODY

text: quested records or for other procedural
label: BODY

text: deficiency or because requested records
label: BODY

text: cannot be located shall be in writing
label: BODY

text: and shall include:
label: BODY

text: (i) A description of the basis of the
label: BODY

text: decision;
label: BODY

text: (ii) A list of the names and titles or
label: BODY

text: positions of each person responsible;
label: BODY

text: and
label: BODY

text: (iii) A statement that the matter
label: BODY

text: may be appealed to the Assistant Sec-
label: BODY

text: retary—Policy, Budget and Adminis-
label: BODY

text: tration and a description of the proce-
label: BODY

text: dures in § 2.18 for appeal.
label: BODY

text: Time limits for processing initial
label: BODY

text: requests.
label: BODY

text: (a) Basic limit. Requests for records
label: BODY

text: shall be processed promptly. A deter-
label: BODY

text: mination whether to grant or deny a
label: BODY

text: request shall be made within no more
label: BODY

text: than 10 working days after receipt of a
label: BODY

text: request. This determination shall be
label: BODY

text: communicated immediately to the re-
label: BODY

text: quester.
label: BODY

text: (b) Running of basic time limit. (1) The
label: BODY

text: 10 working day time limit begins to
label: BODY

text: run when a request meeting the re-
label: BODY

text: quirements of § 2.14(b) is received at a
label: BODY
